content:
• Thursday, August 8, 2013
  • JCOM

    j2 Global rallies on Q2 beat

    • j2 Global (JCOM +4.4%) closes higher after its Q2 beat. The company set a new 52-week high earlier in the day ($50.13) before selling off slightly.
    • EBITDA was $66.4M, up 39.8% Y/Y.
    • Free cash flow was $66.2M, up 45.2% Y/Y.
    • A $27M patent settlement lifted results, contributing $12.6M to revenue, $8M to FCF, and $0.17 to EPS.
    • 2013 guidance was re-affirmed on the CC. j2 expects 2013 revenue of $510M-535M (consensus $517.3M) and EPS of $2.78-2.98 (consensus $2.86).
     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 PM
  • SFUN

    SouFun rockets up on Q2 beat, guidance

    • SouFun (SFUN +13.1%) rocketed higher after its Q2 beat,Â striking new 52-week highs in the process. The company continues to grow rapidly in the face of concerns about China's property market.
    • E-commerce services revenue grew 84.2% Y/Y to $45M. Marketing revenue grew 6% Y/Y to 58.9M. Listing services (in the secondary home market) sales were white-hot, growing 147.3% to $38.4M.
    • Operating income grew 59.6% to $75.8M, on the back of strong top-line growth and "effective cost control that resulted in a 2.6% improvement in operating margin."
    • The company is a cash cow: operating cash flow +80.4% Y/Y to $80M.
    • Soufun raised its 2013 revenue guidance range to $538M-548M from $527M-$538M (consensus is already at $542.2M). VP Hong Zhao said the forecast "very conservatively" implies the company will grow "at least 50% [Y/Y] per quarter."
    • Previous: Q2 results, CC.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:20 PM
  • MM

    Millennial Media shares close up following news of LatAm partnership

    • Shares of Millennial Media (MM +8.2%) closed higher on the day, after the company announced it has formed a strategic partnership with Latin American mobile ad network Adsmovil.
    • With the deal, Adsmovil will leverage Millennial's first-party data to enable brands to more directly target consumers through mobile ads.
    • The market opportunity is enormous: there are 400M mobile users in Latin America, and smartphone penetration is expected to reach almost 40% by 2016 (per eMarketer).
    • Millennial will release Q2 results Aug. 13. Analysts expect EPS of -$0.01 and revenue of $59.24M. CC scheduled for 5pm ET (webcast).
    • Previous: eMarketer estimates global mobile ad sales will grow 79% in 2013, with Millennial taking $120M of the pie (+71% Y/Y).
     
     
     
     
    | 8:04 PM | 1 Comment
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney board defends Ullman, disagrees with Ackman

    • J.C. Penney's (NYSE:JCP) -3.4% AH after its board provides a harsh response to Bill Ackman's letter calling on the struggling retailer to quickly find a new CEO to replace Mike Ullman.
    • Chairman Tom Engibous: "The Board of Directors strongly disagrees with Mr. Ackman and is extremely disappointed that his letter was released to the media at the same time that it was sent to the Board."
    • Engibous also defends Ullman: "The Company has made significant progress since [Ullman] returned as CEO four months ago .. Mike is the right person to rebuild jcpenney."
    • Nonetheless, Engibous admits a CEO search "began in earnest three weeks ago." He promises it will be "careful and deliberate."
    • Ex-CEO Allen Questrom says he's willing to return as chairman, but only if he's happy with J.C. Penney's new CEO.
    • Shares rose 6.7% in regular trading thanks to Ackman's letter, and a CNBC report stating J.C. Penney is looking to replace Ullman.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:37 PM | 8 Comments
  • GERN

    Geron EPS in-line, misses on revenue

    • Geron (NASDAQ:GERN): Q2 loss of $0.07 in-line.
    • Revenue $112K misses by $388K. (PR)
    • Shares +7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:36 PM
  • ONXX

    More on Onyx Pharmaceuticals earnings

    • Onyx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ONXX) Q2 beats across the board.
    • Net losses narrowed as sales more than doubled from a year ago.
    • Operating expenses grew 12% to $200.6M.
    • Announces that it's partnering with Idis Limited to initiate a Managed Access Program for carfilzomib, a treatment for multiple myeloma, in certain countries in Europe.
    • Shares +1.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:17 PM
  • EXPE

    Online travel stocks tick higher AH following Priceline's Q2 report

    • Expedia (NASDAQ:EXPE) and TripAdvisor (NASDAQ:TRIP) +1% AH after Priceline beats Q2 estimates and issues solid Q3 guidance.
    • Priceline (PCLN - +5.3% AH) expects Q3 gross travel bookings to rise 27%-34% Y/Y in Q3 vs. 38% in Q2, thanks largely to international bookings growth of 32%-39% (domestic bookings are expected to rise 5%-10%). Revenue is seen rising 23%-30% vs. 27% in Q2.
    • Priceline's international bookings rose 44% Y/Y in Q2, and domestic bookings 12%. Hotel room nights (+38%), rental car days (+46%), and air tickets (+1.8%) all grew at a faster Y/Y clip than in Q1.
    • However, the company's online ad spend rose 47% Y/Y to a sizable $463.1M (it rose 45% Y/Y in Q1), evidence online travel firms continue to compete aggressively over Google keywords.
    • Orbitz (NYSE:OWW) +0.6% AH after soaring 36.7% in regular trading thanks to its Q2 revenue beat and strong guidance.
    • Orbitz expects Q3 revenue of $214M-$220M (above a $213.8M consensus), and 2013 revenue of $840M-$850M (above an $831.4M consensus). 2013 adjusted EBITDA is expected to grow 8%-10% from 2012's $128.4M.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:07 PM
  • MODN

    Model N beats by $0.16, beats on revenues

    • Model N (NYSE:MODN): FQ3 EPS of $0.14 beats by $0.16.
    • Revenue of $27.2M (+20% Y/Y) beats by $0.21M. Shares -23% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • NPSP

    More on NPS Pharmaceutical's earnings

    • NPS Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:NPSP) reports a wider than expected Q2 loss, but revenues came in above analyst estimates.
    • U.S. launch of Gattex accelerating with net product sales of $4.8M for the quarter.
    • The company now expects to achieve global Gattex/Revestive sales of $25M to $30M in 2013 with 275 to 325 patients on therapy by the end of the year.
    • Says it's preparing to engage in the pricing and reimbursement processes in key European countries with the goal of commercially launching Revestive in Europe in the first half of 2014.
    • With an estimated 6K to 12K patients eligible for treatment in targeted ex-U.S. countries, the company believes the international peak annual sales opportunity for Revestive is greater than that of Gattex in the U.S.
    • Shares +6.1% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:50 PM

  • After-hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: UBNT +23%. OLED +22%. MEET +22%. NOAH +15%. DATA +12%.
    • Top losers: MCP -15%. SZYM -11%. DNDN -11%. WMGI -10%. WWWW -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM | 5 Comments
  • DATA

    Tableau on a tear AH, Q3 and full-year guidance strong

    • Tableau (NYSE:DATA) is now up 14.1% AH, after Q2 results trounce consensus.
    • Q2 highlights include adding 1,500 new customer accounts (total of ~13,500) and closing 80 sales orders over $100K (vs. 60/quarter in 2012).
    • License revenue grew to $33.5M (+65.6% Y/Y); maintenance & services revenue grew to $16.4M (+84.4% Y/Y).
    • GAAP net income fell to -$2.58M from $1.06M in Q2 2012 as sales & marketing (+112%), R&D (+88.6%), and G&A (+83.2%) expenses outpaced top-line growth. (10Q)
    • Tableau is guiding for Q3 revenue of $49.5M-51.5M (+57% Y/Y at the midpoint), above a consensus of $46.5M. Management expects operating losses to increase as the company continues making big investments for the sake of future growth.
    • Full-year revenue guidance is $198M-202M (+57 Y/Y at the midpoint), above a consensus of $187.9M.
    • Shares have now more than doubled from May's $31 IPO price.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM
  • CLNE

    More on Clean Energy earnings

    • Clean Energy (NASDAQ:CLNE) Q2 loss comes in better than the Street expected.
    • Gallons delivered totaled 52.6M gallons, up 8% from 48.6M gallons delivered in the same period a year ago.
    • The company says that its 12-liter natural gas engines have been well received by the early adopters and shippers are now starting to request that their contract carriers make the switch to natural gas.
    • Shares +2.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:27 PM
  • YOKU

    Youku Tudou beats by RMB0.11

    • Youku Tudou (NYSE:YOKU): Q2 EPS of -RMB0.63 beats by RMB0.11.
    • Revenue of RMB753.5M. Shares -5.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:21 PM
  • WEB

    Web.com -7.7% AH after announcing $225M debt offering

    • Web.com (WWWW) is offering $225M worth of convertible senior notes due 2018. It plans to use the proceeds from the offering to pay down existing debt. (PR)
    • The company had $668.3M in debt on its balance sheet at the end of Q2.
    • Shares rallied last week in response to Web.com's Q2 beat.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM
  • HSC

    Harsco slips after posting a worse-than-expected Q2

    • Harsco (HSC -5.4%) takes a hit today after the multi-national provider of industrial services and engineered products reported disappointing Q2 earnings.
    • CEO Patrick Decker cites its Metals & Minerals business for the miss, saying the unit continues to face macro industry challenges and as a result, performed below expectations.
    • The company also posted guidance below the Street consensus, now expecting Q3 EPS of $0.17 to $0.22.
    • The Street view for $0.39.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • NPSP

    NPS Pharma misses by $0.08, beats on revenues

    • NPS Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:NPSP): Q2 EPS of -$0.13 misses by $0.08.
    • Revenue of $36.5M beats by $4.88M. Shares +4.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM

  • More on Dendreon; CFO resigns

    • On August 5, CFO and Treasurer Gregory T. Schiffman notified the company that he would be leaving effective December 31, 2013.
    • Starting August 9, Gregory R. Cox, currently VP, Finance, will assume the role of Interim Chief Financial Officer.
    • As Interim CFO, Mr. Cox will be the company’s principal financial officer as well as its principal accounting officer, the role he currently assumes.
    • Mr. Schiffman will stay on to assist with the transition while the company searches for a permanent replacement.
    • Shares -11.6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • NOG

    Northern Oil & Gas misses by $0.04, misses on revenues

    • Northern Oil & Gas (NYSEMKT:NOG): Q2 EPS of $0.23 misses by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $96.2M beats by $10.31M. Shares -1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • OLED

    Universal Display soars on strong materials sales, guidance

    • Universal Display (NASDAQ:OLED) expects 2013 revenue "to reach the high end of its $110M-$125M guidance range" That's going over well in light of fears the opposite might hold true due to softer-than-expected Galaxy S4 sales. Consensus is at $118.8M.
    • Q2 materials sales +111% Y/Y to $27.1M. Royalty/license fees +37% Y/Y to $21.2M (payments from Samsung recognized in Q2 and Q4). Possible reasons for surging materials sales: Samsung's strong low-end/mid-range smartphone sales, and rising green emitter use.
    • Materials gross margin (a concern following the Q1 report) was 69.4% vs. 75.8% in Q1 and 87.5% a year ago.
    • R&D spend +1% Y/Y to $7.3M, SG&A +22% to $6.4M. Patent/amortization costs doubled to $4.5M; Universal attributes this to the Fujitsu deal.
    • Operating cash flow +136% Y/Y to $26.4M.
    • OLED +20.4% AH. CC at 5PM ET. Q2 results, PR.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM
  • GERN

    Geron EPS in-line, misses on revenues

    • Geron (NASDAQ:GERN): Q2 EPS of -$0.07 in-line.
    • Revenue of $112K misses by $388K. Shares +7.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp -7.5% AH on disappointing Q2 results

    • Molycorp (MCP) -7.5% AH after reporting a wider Q2 loss even as revenue rose, as sales prices dropped sharply.
    • Loss attributable to common shareholders was $0.44/share vs. a loss of $0.71 a year earlier when fewer shares were outstanding; excluding costs associated with its expansion and other items, the loss widened to $0.36/share from $0.03 a year ago.
    • Average selling price for MCP’s rare metals was $272.14/kg vs. $187.35 a year ago, while rare metals production was flat.
    • Had $264M cash on hand at the end of Q2; expects to spend ~$432M on capex this year vs. last year's $790M spent.
    • Says it is seeing increasingly bullish signals from customers across several segments for product demand, which will coincide with higher production capacity at Mountain Pass.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM
  • DNDN

    More on Dendreon earnings

    • Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN) Q2 misses on all counts
    • The company notes that the competitive environment remains largely unchanged from the first quarter.
    • Based upon current enrollment trends in July and August, it doesn't expect to see enough of a sales increase in H2 to meet its goal of growing Provenge Y/Y.
    • The company currently has $280.6M in cash, cash equivalents, and short-term and long-term investments, compared to $429.8M as of December 31, 2012.
    • Shares -12% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM
  • MNST

    Monster Beverage slides on not so monstrous quarter

    • Shares of Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST) are fading AH following the company's Q2 miss.
    • Net sales rose 6.5% Y/Y during the period.
    • MNST incurred $4.2M in costs "related to regulatory matters and litigation concerning the advertising, marketing, promotion, ingredients, usage, [and] safety" of its drinks. "There were certain exceptional costs that affected profitability during the quarter," CEO Rodney Sacks notes.
    • The company also says Y/Y sales to its Japanese distributor were "significantly lower" during the quarter (the brand launched in Japan in Q2 2012). (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • UBNT

    Ubiquiti Networks beats by $0.06, beats on revenues

    • Ubiquiti Networks (NASDAQ:UBNT): FQ4 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.06.
    • Revenue of $101.2M (+22% Y/Y) beats by $7.92M. Shares +20.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • OLED

    Universal Display beats by $0.07, beats on revenues

    • Universal Display (NASDAQ:OLED): Q2 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.07.
    • Revenue of $49.4M (+65% Y/Y) beats by $11.45M. Shares +18.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • BKNG

    Priceline rises as earnings impress, guidance solid

    • Shares of Priceline (PCLN) are now up 5% AH as investors digest the company's Q2 report.
    • Gross profit and adjusted net income rise 37.8% and 25.6% Y/YÂ respectively.
    • Revenue rises 27% from Q2 2012.
    • Q3 outlook summary: Y/Y gross travels bookings growth of 27-34% (+32-39% international and +5-10% domestic); Y/Y revenue growth of 23-30%; adjusted EPS of $15.30-15.60. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • PDLI

    PDL Biopharma beats by $0.13, beats on revenue

    • PDL BioPharma (NASDAQ:PDLI): Q2 EPS of $0.67 beats by $0.13.
    • Revenue of $143.6M (+14% Y/Y) beats by $5.4M. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • RNDY

    Roundy's misses by $0.03, beats on revenues

    • Roundy's (NYSE:RNDY): Q2 EPS of $0.3 misses by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $980.3M (-1.7% Y/Y) beats by $39.7M. Shares -9.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • CLNE

    Clean Energy beats by $0.10, beats on revenue

    • Clean Energy Fuels (NASDAQ:CLNE): Q2 EPS loss of $0.07 beats by $0.10.
    • Revenue of $88.1M (+26% Y/Y) beats by $870K. (PR)
    • Shares +0.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • DATA

    Tableau Software beats by $0.18, beats on revenues

    • Tableau Software (NYSE:DATA): FQ3 EPS of $0.01 beats by $0.18.
    • Revenue of $49.9M (+71% Y/Y) beats by $3.4M. Shares +5.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 2 Comments
  • BKNG

    Priceline beats, shares rise

    • Priceline (PCLN): Q2 EPS of $9.70 beats by $0.34.
    • Revenue of $1.68B beats by $20M (PR)
    • Total gross bookings: +38% Y/Y.
    • Q3 guidance: $15.30-16.30/share versus consensus of $15.86. (PR)
    • Shares +3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • DNDN

    Dendreon misses by $0.03, revenue misses

    • Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN): Q2 EPS loss of $0.45 misses by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $73.3M misses by $2.31M. (PR)
    • Shares -4.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 4 Comments
  • LGF.A

    Lions Gate Entertainment beats by $0.10, beats on revenues

    • Lions Gate Entertainment (LGF): FQ1 EPS of $0.18 beats by $0.1.
    • Revenue of $569.7M beats by $48.17M. Shares +5.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp misses estimates

    • Molycorp (MCP): Â Q2 EPS -$0.36 misses by $0.13.
    • Revenue of $136.9M misses by $21M. (PR)
    • Shares -3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • MDRX

    Allscripts-Misys Healthcare misses by $0.04, misses on revenues

    • Allscripts-Misys Healthcare (NASDAQ:MDRX): Q2 EPS of $0.05 misses by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $347.1M misses by $12.9M. Shares -3.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • RAX

    Rackspace EPS beats by $0.03, revenue beats,

    • Rackspace (NYSE:RAX): EPS of $0.16 beats by $0.03.
    • Revenue of $375.9M (+18% Y/Y) beats by $3.6M.
    • Adjusted free cash flow of $11M vs. net income of $22M.
    • Shares -4.1% AH. CC at 4:30PM ET (webcast). (PR)
    • Update (4:07PM): Shares have reversed course, and are now up 6.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM | 2 Comments
  • IAG

    IAMGOLD signs new power rates agreement for Suriname mine, shares +16%

    • IAMGOLD (IAG +16.2%) surges higher on news of yesterday's agreement for lower power rates with the Republic of Suriname for its Rosebel gold mine.
    • IAGÂ says lower power rates in areas surrounding the current operation will allow it to potentially reduce its costs by up to $50/oz. and extend the life of the mine.
    • In April, IAG signed a joint venture with the government to target softer ore at $0.11/kwh near its mine.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • ELLI

    Ellie Mae soars, Bloomberg reports company considering sale

    • Three sources tell Bloomberg Ellie Mae (ELLI +11%) is "considering a sale and has interviewed banks to manage the process."
    • Ellie Mae, which has jumped to new highs on the news, reportedly might start "soliciting bids in the next two months."
    • The mortgage origination software vendor saw its shares take off last Friday thanks to the strong Q3 guidance included within its Q2 report.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • HL

    Hecla Mining +10% on forecast gains in production

    • Hecla Mining (HL +10.8%) expects rising silver and gold production in H2, as output at the Lucky Friday silver mine in Idaho returns to normal and as it continues to ramp up output at the recently acquired Casa Berardi gold mine in Quebec.
    • Casa Berardi will generate significant cash flow for many years, but several expenses related to the transaction hit hard in Q2: "We do not consider it a representative quarter from a financial standpoint due all of the one-time items," CEO Phillips Baker said in the earnings call.
    • HL received an average silver price of $16.27/oz. in Q2 vs. $27.05 in the year-ago period, but higher output boosted total revenue 27% Y/Y.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • ANV

    Allied Nevada downgraded by Cowen

    • Allied Nevada (ANV +2%) is downgraded to Market Perform with a $6.56 target price (from $20.51) by Cowen, as low gold prices and operational setbacks pose financing challenges.
    • ANV has put its $1.2B Hycroft expansion on hold after two years and ~70% of capex spent due to a shortfall in funding, moving to a leach-only plan; with new 2013-15 volume guidance significantly cut and a mine life of 6-7 years, the firm does not see a path to generate sufficient cash flows to fund mill construction at current gold prices.
    • Shares are higher, along with most gold miners, as strong economic data from China sparks broad gains in commodities and industrial metals.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM
  • CG

    Carlyle loses Buy rating at Citigroup

    • Carlyle (CG -2.8%) slips after Citigroup pulls its Buy rating on the stock citing valuation. The price target is cut to $29 from $32.
    • The stock is a notable underperformer when measured against its P-E brethren over the past year, up just 12% vs. Oaktree, KKR, Apollo, and Blackstone all up 40-100%.
    • Yesterday: Q2 results.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM
  • ECTE

    Echo Therapeutics trades lower despite beating on Q2 EPS

    • Echo Therapeutics (OTC:ECTE -4.3%) doesn't get much love from an upbeat Q2 report today, easily beating on its EPS but still trading lower.
    • Its net loss was $0.51 per share. Estimates were for an $0.81 loss.
    • R&D costs increased, primarily related to increased engineering and design expenses incurred with outside contractors and personnel.
    • SG&A expenses also increased, due to increased Marketing and Manufacturing personnel and expenses related to prelaunch marketing and manufacturing activities.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • CSII

    Cardiovascular Systems soars on earnings beat, upgrade

    • Cardiovascular Systems (CSII +11.2%) posts double-digit gains following the company's FQ4 beat.
    • Revenue growth was 26% for the period.
    • FQ1 outlook: Net loss of $0.39-0.42/ share on revenue of $27.5-28.5M against consensus of a $0.31/ share loss on sales of $26.12M.
    • Feltl upgrades the shares to Strong Buy.
    • Conference call transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM
  • HIW

    Highwoods slips after after secondary offering

    • HIWÂ off 2.5% Â to $35.37 after the company prices a 3.75M share secondary at about $3.49 per share. Gross proceeds were $133.1M. If the greenshoe option is taken up, the deal will add about 5% to the float. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM
  • OSUR

    OraSure takes off after earnings beat, guidance

    • OraSure (OSUR +16.1%) is among the day's big winners after the company reported a Q2 loss that was narrower than analysts expected.
    • Revenue growth of 8% for the period was attributable to strong sales of OSUR's "molecular collection systems and infectious disease testing products."
    • OSUR guided for a Q3 net loss of $0.09-0.10/ share versus Street estimates of a $0.12 loss. Revenue guidance is in line with consensus. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • SBY

    Buyers emerge for Silver Bay Realty after earnings

    • Revenue gained 40% Q/Q to $10.7M as 1,197 previously vacant homes were leased. Net operating income of $3.1M up 79% from Q1. GAAP income remains negative ($6.8M or $0.18 per share) as many homes still in renovation or leasing stage.
    • Company owns 5,571 single family homes, up 21% Q/Q. 985 additional properties acquired in Q2.
    • New metric introduced: Estimated net asset value per share of $18.95 based on estimated fair value of properties. Book value - which contains no estimate of property price appreciation - is $17.30 per share.
    • Occupancy rate for stabilized properties of 94% up 200 bps from Q1. Rate for properties owned 6 months or more of 87% up 600 bps. Rate for entire portfolio of 65% up 1200 bps. Average monthly rent of $1,148 down $8. (PR)
    • Notes from earnings call (transcript):
    • Pace of property purchases has slowed in Q3 as company focuses on getting the ones they already own up to snuff and rented out.
    • The company has not yet repurchased any stock (buyback authorization of 2.5M shares came on July 1).
    • JPMorgan's Anthony Paolone tries to draw management out on if repair and maintenance costs are going according to plan, and CFO Christine Battist allows that they're a bit higher than anticipated. COO Pat Freydberg says there's not a material difference from expectations, though he'd like to see a higher volume of data before drawing conclusions.
    • SBY +3.5%. Other single family names: American Homes 4 Rent (AMH +2.4%), American Residential Properties (ARPI +2%).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM
  • SCMP

    Sucampo Pharmaceuticals slips despite releasing positive top line data

    • Sucampo Pharmaceuticals (SCMP -3.3%) slips today, despite announcing earlier that it had achieved positive top-line results from two recently completed Phase 1a clinical trials of both cobiprostone and SPI-3608.
    • The studies tested the tolerability and pharmacokinetic profiles versus placebo of the two compounds, both of which were demonstrated to be generally well-tolerated in the tested populations.
    • SPI-3608 is being investigated for the treatment of mild to moderate lumbar spinal stenosis and may be investigated for additional indications in the future.
    • The next phase of development for SPI-3608 is expected to begin in the first quarter of 2014.
    • Data on cobiprostone showed that it induces mucosal barrier repair and prevents mucosal barrier damage, and the fact that it was well-tolerated in this study, the company says, is extremely encouraging.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • CHU

    China Unicom moving up on H1 results; rivals also higher

    • China Unicom (CHU +6.5%), China's second-largest mobile carrier, is trading up after releasing H1 results.
    • The carrier's H1 numbers impressed, with revenue of 144.31B yuan up 19% Y/Y and earnings of 5.32B yuan (3.43B yuan a year ago) surpassing a consensus of 4.89B yuan.
    • Profitability continues to rise as the first carrier to adopt the iPhone in China reaps the rewardsÂ of out-sized subscription and data revenue growth.

Fusion-io launched ioScale in January as a low-cost/high-density alternative to its mainstay ioDrive modules.

Raymond James uses the occasion to argue LSI is well-position to become the #2 player in the enterprise server flash module space.
    • Lazard is (kind of) among the defenders. "We don't see enough evidence that competition is marginalizing FIO ... We see revenue lumpiness and some executive missteps."

    • Groupon (GRPN +25.9%) is at levels last seen in June '12 after beating Q2 revenue estimates on the back of strong North American growth, announcing a $300M buyback and the end of its CEO search, and compelling two analysts to belatedly upgrade shares to neutral.
